summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 discussing overtime staffing and AWOL (Absent Without Leave) statuses at a correctional facility, specifically referencing the need to confirm voluntary vs. mandatory overtime for staff on August 9-10, 2019. It appears to be internal administrative communication regarding prison operations.

persons.name: Officer Noel
persons.context: Mentioned as the only officer whose Saturday overtime was not voluntary, indicating a staffing issue.

events.title: Friday Overtime Staffing
events.description: On Friday, August 9, 2019, from 4pm to 12am, there were 21 posts with 20 staff present, including 6 overtime shifts.

events.title: Saturday Overtime Staffing
events.description: On Saturday, August 10, 2019, from 12am to 8am, there were 19 posts with 18 staff present, including 10 overtime shifts, with Officer Noel's overtime noted as not voluntary.

keyFacts: There were 11 individuals AWOL (Absent Without Leave) for the entire week, each for 40 hours.
All overtime was voluntary except for one instance involving Officer Noel on Saturday, August 10, 2019.
The email chain expresses concern that using this information against the union could lead to staff refusing to volunteer for overtime, forcing mandatory assignments.
The communication is focused on administrative staffing and overtime logistics at a correctional facility.
The document date is August 14, 2019, discussing events from the prior weekend (August 9-10, 2019).
